channel.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
channel.description:
i want to run a standalone server with no internet connection on my computer. i already have the cache, but everytime i run the moparscape client it tries to download the cache anyway.
the cache i have is 24.7MB from the actual rs game. i copied the .file_store_32 folder from a computer with an internet connection and pasted it onto my standalone computer. pretty sure i renamed the folder correctly and i know its in the right spot. i have tried putting all the files in the folder into a zip archive, just leaving them in the folder, making another folder...etc.
all i need to know is can i make the moparscape client skip trying to download the cache? :confused: (and obviously how to make it skip the download if i can)

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

the cache i have now is from some months ago. ill check the date real quick if i can.

my most recent modified by date is 1/15/07. so thats the last time i played normal RS.

(ps: im new to the whole moparscape scene. im not 100% sure what the 337 cache or 459 client are. my guess is something like the release/build number?)[br][size=1]Posted on: June 15, 2007, 12:56:14 PM[/size][hr]ok…downloaded the cache from moparscape seperately, and its still not working. any help out there?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2007, 06:07:37 PM[/size][hr]i’ve tried following the “Getting started on your server, and learning how to code it” tutorial, but it’s not working for me. anyone know of a tutorial for standalone/LAN servers?

Read full topic
item.source: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

The newest cache you can use is the 377.
You would need a 459 client and to build a 459 server for the current rs cache.
But you would still need to make your client load the 377. o.0

Read full topic
item.source: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

I Br3ndan I:

How are you posting on here if your Internet is disconnected…

same way i got the moparscape client/servers, different computer.

[quote=“VorargC, post:5, topic:111309”]You have to use the moparscape cache for the 317 client.
And if you have that, make sure it is in C:/WINDOWS
named .mpr_file_store_32
I think ^[/quote]

so i can’t use the normal rs cache for moparscape?

the whole idea of this is that i can run a functional server on a lan at my house, with no computer needing an internet connection.

i should probably also mention that i have like 4 other clients because i downloaded the client/server pack. i have an eyrescape client and whatever else came in the pack. i wanted to use the moparscape client because it has the option to change ports + ip’s, and the other ones don’t have such a convenient feature. so it doesn’t absolutely have to be using the moparscape client if someone knows a way to do this with a different client.

Read full topic
item.source: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

You have to use the moparscape cache for the 317 client.
And if you have that, make sure it is in C:/WINDOWS
named .mpr_file_store_32
I think ^

Read full topic

item.source: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

i think you kinda missed my whole point

very simply put:
computer = not connected to the internet

cache download = not needed. already have the cache.

the client won’t advance until it downloads the cache. which i already have, so it doesn’t need to (and can’t anyway). already have my own server, which i have running.

i should probably make sure that i can use the moparscape client with my own server. that is possible right? i just assumed it was because you can change ip and ports.

Read full topic
item.source: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?

item.title: Skip the cache download with moparscape client?
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Try using the WebClient. And no, you cannot skip downloading the cache, then you wont be able to use the client.

Read full topic
